Package engine.board

Class BoardInfo

java.lang.Object
engine.board.BoardInfo
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class BoardInfo extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a chess board state using Forsyth–Edwards Notation. This class implements the Serializable interface to allow the deep-copy functionality of the clone method.

This class provides several useful methods to check various conditions regarding the board state, however all fields are public. The intent of this class is to be used as a struct or record by a Board object, where the BoardInfo instance variable should always be private.

See Also:

    • castleq

      public boolean castleq
      Whether black castling on the queenside is allowed.

    • enPassantTile

      public Coordinate enPassantTile
      The tile, if one exists, onto which a pawn can move to capture en passant style. This is not the tile on which the enemy pawn exists, but the tile immediately behind the enemy pawn (where said pawn would be if it had only moved one tile forward instead of two).

    • halfmoves

      public int halfmoves
      The number of halfmoves since the last pawn move. Used to enforce the 50-move rule.

    • fullmoves

      public int fullmoves
      The running total of fullmoves made. Incremented after the black player's turn.

    • threefoldRepetitionTracker

      public Map<String,Integer> threefoldRepetitionTracker
      A mapping of all the FEN strings and the number of times they occured during the game.

    • tilesOpponentControls

      public List<Coordinate> tilesOpponentControls
      A list of tiles controlled by the enemy player.

  • Constructor Details

    • BoardInfo

      public BoardInfo(Piece[][] tiles, boolean whiteToMove, boolean castleK, boolean castleQ, boolean castlek, boolean castleq, Coordinate enPassantTile, int halfmoves, int fullmoves)
      Constructs a new BoardInfo object from the information in a FEN string. This constructor should only be used by FenUtility.informationFromFen because of the complexity of the arguments. When creating a new BoardInfo object, the fen utility class should be used as a factory over the raw access of this construtor.
      Parameters:
      tiles - a 2d array of pieces, representing the pieces on each tile of the board. If there is not a piece on a given tile, that index is null.
      whiteToMove - whether it is the white player's turn to move.
      castleK - whether white castling on the kingside is allowed.
      castleQ - whether white castling on the queenside is allowed.
      castlek - whether black castling on the kingside is allowed.
      castleq - whether black castling on the queenside is allowed.
      enPassantTile - the tile for en passant, or null if no such tile exists.
      halfmoves - the numer of half moves (incremented after every turn, reset to 0 after a pawn moves).
      fullmoves - the number of full moves (incremented after the black player's turn).
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if tiles == null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if tiles is not an 8x8 array.
      IllegalArgumentException - if halfmoves < 0.
      IllegalArgumentException - if fullmoves < 0.

  • Method Details

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece(Coordinate c)
      Retrieves a piece from the board given a valid coordinate on the board. The tiles field of this class, which is accessed by this method, if the only private field. This is done to avoid confusion with row vs column major ordering. This method makes getting pieces easier through the Coordinate class.

      The X/Y coordinate system (used by the Coordinate class, where the chess board represents quadrant I on the cartesian plane with the origin (0, 0) at A1) is in column-major order.

      The access into the tiles array is in row-major order. The correct access for a piece on the tile A4 (x=0, y=3) for example would be:

      tiles[3][0]

      Parameters:
      c - the coordinate of the requested piece.
      Returns:
      the piece on the requested tile. If the tile is valid but no piece exists, null is returned.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if c == null or !(c.isValidTile()).
      See Also:
      • Coordinate

    • setPiece

      public void setPiece(Coordinate c, Piece p)
      Sets the piece on a given tile. The method exists instead of allowing direct access to the tiles array for the reasons described in the getPiece documentation. The piece will always be placed on the given tile (overriding existing pieces if needed) as long as the coordinate is valid. The argument p is allowed to be null which effectively clears the piece on the specified tile.
      Parameters:
      c - the coordinate of the requested piece.
      p - the piece to place.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if c == null or !(c.isValidTile()).

    • getTilesWithPiece

      public List<Coordinate> getTilesWithPiece(Piece piece)
      Returns a list of Coordinate objects pointing to the tiles containing a piece of the same kind and color as the argument. Piece equality is checked using the Piece::equals method.
      Parameters:
      piece - an example piece of the same the variety (type and color) to find on the board.
      Returns:
      a list of Coordinate objects. If the argument piece is null, an empty list is returned. An empty list may also be returned if piece.equals(pieceOnTile) == false for all pieces in the tiles array.
      See Also:
      • Piece

    • inferState

      public BoardInfo.State inferState()
      Determines the state of the game. This method does not modify any properties of this BoardInfo object, it only accesses them.
      Returns:
      a property of the BoardInfo.State enumerator.
      See Also:
      • BoardInfo.State

    • updateAfterMove

      public void updateAfterMove()
      Updates the properties of this object after a move has been made.

      This "update" is defined through some common changes after each move:

      • Updates the number of fullmoves after the black player's turn.
      • Changes the player.
      • Calls the more generic update method.

      The second update method exists and is called by this method because the operations performed by update are also done upon the construction of a BoardInfo object, while the operations within this method are only performed after a move has been made.

    • clone

      public Object clone()
      Returns a deep-copy of this BoardInfo object.
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      a deep-copy of this BoardInfo object. The returned type is Object, but is guaranteed to be castable to BoardInfo if not null. Upon any error, null is returned.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this BoardInfo object.

      The returned string is composed of:

      • The FEN string of this object.
      • The 8x8 grid, from the white player's perspective (A1 as the bottom-left tile). This grid contains the "." character for any blank tile, and the letters "PNBRQK" for the different pieces, as used in FEN notation. Lowercase letters represent black pieces, uppercase letters represent white pieces.

      An example of this string for the starting position of a chess game is:

      rnbqkbnr/pppppppp/8/8/8/8/PPPPPPPP/RNBQKBNR w KQkq - 0 1
      r n b q k b n r
      p p p p p p p p
      . . . . . . . .
      . . . . . . . .
      . . . . . . . .
      . . . . . . . .
      P P P P P P P P
      R N B Q K B N R

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
